preprocess.tokenize

Interface Tokenizer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GeneralTokenizer

    public interface Tokenizer
    The Tokenizer creates Submissions from a path.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<Submission> exploreSubmissionDirectory(SubmissionStructure submissionStructure, java.nio.file.Path location)
      Iterates through a given Path with a specified SubmissionStructure to collect all submissions of students.
      java.util.List<java.nio.file.Path> getEmptySubmissions()
      Returns a list of empty submission locations.

    • Method Detail

      • exploreSubmissionDirectory

        java.util.List<Submission> exploreSubmissionDirectory(SubmissionStructure submissionStructure,
                                                    java.nio.file.Path location)
                                                      throws MaximumDirectoryDepthExceededException
        Iterates through a given Path with a specified SubmissionStructure to collect all submissions of students.
        Parameters:
        submissionStructure - A valid structure the location will be validated against.
        location - Where we search for files that belong to submissions
        Returns:
        For each detected Submission it returns a Submission object in a list. Returns empty list if exploration fails.
        Throws:
        MaximumDirectoryDepthExceededException - When the directory tree under scrutiny is deeper than maxDirectoryDepth (a constant defined in the sanitizer implementations), this exception is thrown in order to avoid a stack explosion.

      • getEmptySubmissions

        java.util.List<java.nio.file.Path> getEmptySubmissions()
        Returns a list of empty submission locations. This is used by the to generate a list of students who will be notified.
        Returns:
        a list of empty locations
